In Document manuscript.pdf in page 43:

"In civil or commercial matters a judicial authority of a Contracting State may, in accordance with the provisions of the law of that State, request the competent authority of another Contracting State, by means of a Letter of Request, to obtain evidence, or to perform some other judicial act."

German judicial authorities will not grant requests for deposing witnesses by legal counsel or for the production of documents. Witnesses must be summoned to a German court for examination. The German municipal court will apply German procedure unless special procedures are requested such as a literal transcription of the proceedings or cross-examination by legal counsel.

In Document english_master_glossary_02_2011.pdf in page 45:

WITNESS, HOSTILE - A witness whose relationship to the opposing party is such that his or her testimony may be prejudiced against that party. A witness declared to be hostile may be asked leading questions and is subject to cross- examination by the party that called him or her.

WITNESS, MATERIAL - A witness who can give testimony relating to a particular matter that very few others, if any, can give.

WITNESS, PROSECUTION - The person whose complaint commences a criminal prosecution and whose testimony is mainly relied on to secure a conviction at the trial.

New user question: In welchen Fällen beschuldigt sich ein Zeuge selber
llm_response: In Fällen, in denen ein Zeuge sich selbst beschuldigt, spricht man von einem sogenannten "Selbstbelastungszeugen". Dies kann in Situationen auftreten, in denen der Zeuge Informationen preisgibt, die ihn selbst in Verbindung mit der Straftat bringen. In einigen Rechtssystemen kann dies zu rechtlichen Konsequenzen für den Zeugen führen. Ein Beispiel hierfür wäre, wenn ein Zeuge während seiner Aussage eingesteht, an der Straftat beteiligt gewesen zu sein.
